title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was good and it’s not too difficult. Asked basic questions about technical support. Pay was decent too. There are two rounds for the interview. It all went smooth and good.
Interview Questions: Related Tech Support questions and related fields

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple only one round of interviews and they were pretty lenient on being able to find a time in which we could meet. The questions pertained to the job and nothing more.
Interview Questions: Q: What from of Design do your expertise in.

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wichita State University
Interview Descriptions: First had a Phone interview and then a Group interview which also had practical testing and Q&A session. Finally, an One to One interview with Dept Chair. After a week, I have been notified of the decision.
Interview Questions: All the electrical lab and Desktop support questions

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wichita State University
Interview Descriptions: FRIENDLY, SIMPLE AND EASY PROCESS. Quick response. Option to work remote or on site. Work is grant funded. No guarantee for permanent role after 4 years. I encourage others to apply.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wichita State University
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview for background knowledge checks, but mostly checking if the student would be a good fit with the team environment. Overall, a very friendly and welcoming interview. Did accept the position and worked until graduation. Highly recommend to build connections within school.
Interview Questions: How can my previous experience be used in the new team?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy application process online submitting resume and cover letter. After the submission deadline, I was offered a first round of interviews which was a 45min interview with the search committee.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you want to work in this position.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was telephonic, and with a board of the program director and two senior faculty.  It was useful to have the program charter, course catalog, and syllabi available online.
Interview Questions: Questions were based on relevant experience and interpretation of the program vision, mission and values.  Additional questions were administrative, such as commitment and availability, clarifying roles and responsibilities.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wichita State University
Interview Descriptions: Resume submitted online and an interview conducted in the office with managers and director of the department. It was easy. Mostly the behavioral questions and previous work experiences and all. Overall it was good.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multitasking?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Face to face plus a writing piece that allowed them to see your writing skills as well as submitting a porfolio that was viewed by the pannel. afterwards there was a group interview process with yourself and 5 staff memebers.
Interview Questions: What are your goals

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wichita State University
Interview Descriptions: I had earlier taken a class with the professor. When I showed my interest in the position, the professor told me to send my resume. A few days later, I was called take the offer letter and fill the required documents for the position.
Interview Questions: No questions, except I had done well in the previous classes with the professor

title: Cadman Art Gallery Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: after the application gets selected it will be a direct interview with the supervisor. As schedules, the interview will be taking place for around 40 minutes where all sort of personality and interpersonal questions would be asked.
Interview Questions: What motivates you to work for a gallery

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: i applied online and got selected for face to face interview,they asked me why should we hire you and they asked me some questions about my past work experience, tell me about yourself.
Interview Questions: why do you think you will be a perfect fit for this position?

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, took eight weeks to hear from anyone. When the hiring manager called and asked if I was still interested in the job, she sounded surprised when I said yes. A panel interview was scheduled for three weeks later. Questions were very basic: What are my strengths and weaknesses? Do I prefer to work alone or with people? Each panel member took a turn asking a question. 

At the end of the interview I was told that the hiring manager would get back to me in two weeks with a decision. It's now five weeks later and I haven't heard anything. I assume I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: How do you manage competing priorities?

title: Director of Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was long and drawn out.  they asked irrelevant questions.  in fact, i thought to myself during the interview.  Who came up with these questions.  Nothing was asked about my leadership style.  nothing was asked about my past experience.  every question asked was a conceptual philosophical question.  it was a waste of time.  i thought to myself, I knew i would not get a call back.  it was a very frustrating process.
Interview Questions: if you experienced a conflict between diversity and excellence, how would you handle it

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two  Rounds, one Round was Technical and other is HR.Technical round by the current employees under the employer and HR was done by, Director of Library Technologies. Was not that difficult and wasnt that easy.
Interview Questions: What kind of technologies have you worked on.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I just spoke to the lecturers interested in having GTA.
They will annonce or you have to fill an application and submit to the deans office.
Its easier if you have seniors leaving their position so you can fill it up.
Always always meet the professors , they can always help.
Interview Questions: Do you have knowledge in his research field?

title: Student Assistant IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted CV. After review, got a call to let me know that I've been conceived an interview. Met the whole staff on that day, toured the facilities and got and explanation of what is to be expected from the position.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to this place?

title: Senior Level Job Within President's Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Highly unorganized, unprofessional, silly and a waste of time.  Wichita State is a sinking ship who has hired some of the most incompetent people to work in leadership.  Their recent issue of the alumni magazine with the "Team" shows what a joke this group of people are.  Too bad they are doing it with such a great school and using taxpayer money to go unicorn hunting.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions, obvious no one was listening.

title: Staff Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took about 5 weeks from the time I submitted my application to the time they called, but I suppose that may be standard with Higher Ed.  First interview was 1.25 hour long phone interview.  They were thorough, but it really was conversational.  Next was an on campus interview - 4 there to interview me as a group.  They each turn asking situational questions.
Interview Questions: Near the end of the interview they surprised me by requesting that I go to the front of the classroom and "teach" them how to improve an existing document that they had created.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: After showing that I had training in graphic design, I was called up and showed my portfolio and interviewed with their full-time designer. We discussed the responsibilities of the job and how you would operate in the system. There was a short office tour and then it was over.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult client?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied through an online recruitment process at WSU, then I got a call after 2-3 weeks for an interview. They took only 1 interview face to face and that's all.
Interview Questions: They asked me about the basics related to hardware and software and the other IT operations. You should know the installation procedures for printers, scanners, network drives, software and drivers, basic troubleshooting steps in case of network failure. The most important thing you have to face students and staff members daily to help and assist them in all their needs.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wichita State University in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was in an office, and sat on a chair. Then the person start questioning. It felt good and everything went smooth. The interviewer was friendly. I was not nervous about it.
Interview Questions: The person asked about my major and CGPA. Also, the knowledge about using the computer software such as MS Office.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Handshake and got an interview. They thoroughly compared my skills to the skills required for the job. They found me to be a match and wanted assurances on loyalty.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty easy. Manager was a straight forward person looking for a person whose profile matches closely with the job description. Also, the manager was very friendly and cooperative. Their assessment about my resume was authentic. they posed quiet few number of technical questions and were satisfied by my qualifications.
Interview Questions: How do you fit for this job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was kind of lengthy and it was regarding my work and my research work as a research assistant and it was technical regarding the production system , quality engineeringand stuff regarding my thesis work
Interview Questions: regarding my past experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was actually asked to apply for the position because I knew the person hiring me.  I had taken one of their classes and had gotten to know them on a project.  I had a very informal interview and was told during the interview the pay and the expected schedule.  It was very laid back.
Interview Questions: Mostly they asked me about my previous position and then we talked about what would be expected on the job.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wichita State University
Interview Descriptions: Two weeks
Interview Questions: What is your research background

title: Test Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Based on experience
Easy for those with experience
Apply online listing all your skills and experience and try to convince the HR that you know what you are doing and with some references to back you.
Your application will be reviewed and you will be called if you meet the requirements.
Interview Questions: What do you know about storage, networking and testing?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wichita State University
Interview Descriptions: Since I am graduate research assistant, I have interviewed with my supervisor first. After a few phone calls and discussions, I got the approval, then it is easy to be accepted to university and work as GRA.
Interview Questions: Some questions on your previous experience and resume. Nothing difficult.

title: QA Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
They go through basic screening and few questions about resume. They may ask you one or two technical questions like What is the difference between overloading and overriding? They told me to tell the result soon.

interview was scheduled with different person. They were not the same people in the confirmation email they sent. They asked all sort of situational questions like "what are your strengths and weakness" The third part is technical. There is where I learnt that the company is more inclined towards bookish knowledge. They may check my analytical skills. The interview is very very easy.
Interview Questions:
They go through basic screening and few questions about resume. They may ask you one or two technical questions like What is the difference between overloading and overriding? They told me to tell the result soon.

interview was scheduled with different person. They were not the same people in the confirmation email they sent. They asked all sort of situational questions like "what are your strengths and weakness" The third part is technical. There is where I learnt that the company is more inclined towards bookish knowledge. They may check my analytical skills. The interview is very very easy.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process mainly focused on your English speaking competency. If you are a graduate student, and have a good standing in your program, you can apply for a TA position in the department. Your English speaking skills will be evaluated by TOEFL speaking score or TSE score. The benchmark for both are respectively 23 and 50. In addition, prior knowledge of the subject is very important to get hired.
Interview Questions: Questions are mainly from the subject you will be teaching.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process for a GTA is quite simple. You study hard and get a GPA of 3.6-4, you have a good chance to be considered for a GTA postion. It is made sure that the individual considered for this position has good knowledge in the subject that he/she is appointed as a GTA
Interview Questions: There would be no questionnaire. You would be appointed as a GTA if the Graduate adviser feels that you can handle the responsibilities efficiently by looking at your score in the subject that you are allotted.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy they asked the basic questions to test my communication and confidence level. it went very smoothly. they verified my gpa and education level and did a baground check which was very easy and they asked me to comeby in few days which i did
Interview Questions: where did u work prior coming here

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wichita State University
Interview Descriptions: submit resume, they call you, go to interview, easy
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Depending on result and language competency, a student gets interviewed by experienced professionals before every semester starts. For different department, interview process is different. Supervisors try to explain the duties and responsibilities. Friendly environment for current students. Once someone gets the job, for next semesters students don't need to sit for another interview.
Interview Questions: What is the goal of your career?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Usually, professors arrange a meeting with the candidate, and it takes about 15-20 minutes. The candidate needs to keep in touch with the professor and convince him to arrange a meeting, where they can discuss research opportunities.
Interview Questions: What is your research interest? What is your GPA? What's your future plan?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS)
Interview Descriptions: I received very helpful information throughout the interview.  Calls into their HR dept were always met with the utmost customer service and care regarding my concerns.  I was given detailed information regarding the interview expectations, and was emailed at each transition point (phone interview, in-person, background check, sign-up process).
Interview Questions: What is your favorite movie and why? (No joke.  They wanted to see how i would react to be sure i was both professional and fun, it worked.)  All other questions were as expected.  The skills test was a bit unexpected (I actually had to perform tasks on the spot and present my rationalizations).

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita Falls, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, after two weeks got an onsite interview and a couple of days after got an offer. The interview was really easy. They verify if you can perform all the duties and how well you can deal with different situations and escenarios.
Interview Questions: Mathematics questions, how can you deal with kids from different backgrounds.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Asked about previous research experience; experience with statistical software
Interview Questions: How proficient with statistical software; Writing examples

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very short process.  I heard about the job through a student group I am a part of.  I went and got an application in person and applied.  About a week later I got a call to set up an interview.  The interview was brief and touched on very basic skills, reactionary questions.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have pertaining to running media equipment and how do you deal with malfunctions with the media.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Usually a panel interview. Questions are situational. Will need to describe experience and how it relates to the position. Questions can actually sometimes be found on the website before showing for the interview. Wichita is very good at sticking the legal practices associated with hiring according to the local, state and federal laws.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great candidate for this position?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wichita State University (Wichita, KS) in Nov 2007
Interview Descriptions: The in-person interview consisted of many situational questions and work history related questions. Everyone seemed friendly and made me feel pretty open to answering.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation with a co-worker that made you uncomfortable and how did you deal with it?
